unnormalised: **Automotive Industry Gears Up with a Flurry of Vehicle Launches**
normalised: **Automotive Industry Gears Up with a Flurry of Vehicle Launches**

unnormalised: New Delhi - The Indian automotive market is witnessing a surge in vehicle launches across various segments, promising enhanced options for consumers this festive season. Dr. Arpita Sharma, head of Automotive Research at IIT Madras, highlights that these launches reflect a growing demand for technologically advanced and fuel-efficient vehicles in the country.
normalised: New Delhi - The Indian automotive market is witnessing a surge in vehicle launches across various segments, promising enhanced options for consumers this festive season. Doctor Arpita Sharma, head of Automotive Research at I I T Madras, highlights that these launches reflect a growing demand for technologically advanced and fuel-efficient vehicles in the country.

unnormalised: Maruti Suzuki recently unveiled its much-anticipated compact SUV, the "Breeza X," boasting improved mileage and safety features. Tata Motors is also set to launch the "Nexon EV Max" with an extended range of 450 km, directly competing with Mahindra’s existing electric vehicle lineup.
normalised: Maruti Suzuki recently unveiled its much-anticipated compact S U V, the "Breeza X," boasting improved mileage and safety features. Tata Motors is also set to launch the "Nexon E V Max" with an extended range of four hundred and fifty kilometer, directly competing with Mahindra’s existing electric vehicle lineup.

unnormalised: Furthermore, several international brands are introducing luxury vehicles targeting the premium segment. Prices range from Rs. 15 Lakhs to Rs. 75 Lakhs depending on the model and features. These launches include models with advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS) and spacious interiors (over 150 sq ft). Experts believe this increased competition will ultimately benefit Indian consumers, offering them greater choice and pushing manufacturers to innovate further. With Diwali around the corner, dealers anticipate a significant boost in sales.
normalised: Furthermore, several international brands are introducing luxury vehicles targeting the premium segment. Prices range from rupee fifteen lakhs to rupee seventy five lakhs depending on the model and features. These launches include models with advanced driver-assistance systems (A D A S) and spacious interiors (over one hundred and fifty square feet). Experts believe this increased competition will ultimately benefit Indian consumers, offering them greater choice and pushing manufacturers to innovate further. With Diwali around the corner, dealers anticipate a significant boost in sales.
